page.title: 14THE ROCHDALE CANAL
page.content: The Rochdale Canal passes through Castleton on its way from Manchester to Yorkshire. When the canal was built in 1804 the village was called Blue Pits. The canal meant that it was possible to travel from the German Ocean (the North Sea) to the Irish Sea, crossing the Pennines. Previously goods could only be transported over the Pennines by pack horse. Many special engineering skills were required and the Castleton section of the canal cost half a million pounds to build. Where Gypsy Lane crossed the canal the world's first skew bridge was built and is remarkably still in existence.
